The Legend of Zelda.passage: The Legend of Zelda is a high-fantasy adventure game series created by Japanese game designer Shigeru Miyamoto and developed by Nintendo. It follows the story of the protagonist, Link, as he embarks on quests to save Hyrule and the fictional universe from evil forces. The series debuted in 1986 with the release of The Legend of Zelda for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). The game introduced many elements that have become staples of the series, such as the open-ended world, the recurring antagonist Ganon, and the iconic item, the Triforce. The series has since expanded to include numerous installments across multiple consoles and handheld devices, with the latest release being Breath of the Wild for the Nintendo Switch in 2017. The games have been critically acclaimed and have sold over 80 million units, making it one of the most successful video game series of all time. The Legend of Zelda has also inspired a cartoon series, a comic book series, and a variety of merchandise. The series' popularity has led to its establishment as a cultural icon, with its gameplay, characters, and storylines widely emulated in both video games and other media.

Petra.passage: Petra is an ancient city located in the southern part of Jordan, near the border with Saudi Arabia. It is famous for its rock-cut architecture and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Petra was established as early as 312 BCE by the Nabataean Arabs, who controlled the trade routes between Arabia, Mesopotamia, and the Roman Empire. The city's structures were carved from the solid rock of the surrounding mountains, making it one of the most iconic archaeological sites in the world. Petra's architectural masterpieces include the Treasury, the Monastery, and the Theatre, which are considered some of the finest examples of ancient engineering and artistry. The city thrived until the 6th century CE, when it was conquered by the Roman Empire. It continued to be an important religious center until the 14th century CE, when it was abandoned due to an earthquake and the rise of new trade routes. New Mexico.passage: New Mexico is a state located in the Southwestern region of the United States. It is bordered by Colorado to the north, Arizona to the west, and Texas to the south. The state is home to 22 Native American tribes, including the Navajo Nation, the Pueblo people, and the Apache. The state's economy is heavily dependent on the tourism industry, with attractions such as the historic Santa Fe Trail, the beautiful landscape of the Sangre de Cristo Mountains, and the annual Burning Man festival. Additionally, the state's oil and natural gas industry contributes significantly to its economy. New Mexico is also known for its cuisine, which includes traditional Spanish dishes, such as chile relleno, as well as Native American dishes, like fry bread.
